"Listen!" he shouted, pointing at Luzhin. 

"This man was engaged to my sister, Avdotya. 

We quarreled two days ago. I drove him out. 

He wrote to my mother, claiming I gave money to Sofya. 

I only gave it to Katerina for the funeral. 

He wanted to turn them against me. 

I told them the truth in front of him. 

Iâ€™ve never met Sofya. 

Luzhin is not worth her little finger."

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov defends Sofya Semyonovna against Luzhin's malicious accusations, asserting his integrity and the truth about his financial dealings.
